meanings.definition: A small, insignificant amount or quantity.
meanings.sent1: I only have a scrat of sugar left for my tea.
meanings.sent2: She added a scrat of salt to the soup for flavor.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant carried a scrat of food back to its nest.
meanings.sent4: His contribution was just a scrat compared to the overall effort.
meanings.sent5: The scrat of light peeking through the curtains illuminated the room.

meanings.definition: To scratch or scrape with the claws or nails.
meanings.sent1: The cat will scrat the post to sharpen its claws.
meanings.sent2: Please don't scrat the furniture with your nails.
meanings.sent3: I watched the bear scrat its back against the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: She had to scrat out the old paint before applying a new coat.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the dog's nails scratting on the floor echoed in the hallway.

meanings.definition: A small, insignificant person or creature.
meanings.sent1: He felt like a scrat in the presence of the famous actors.
meanings.sent2: The tiny scrat scurried away when I approached.
meanings.sent3: The scrat of a mouse caused a commotion in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: She was just a scrat in the grand scheme of things.
meanings.sent5: The scrat of a bird hopping on the ground caught my attention.
